A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Like so many others\, I went to see this film with high expectations after the successes of Force Awakens and the innovations of Rogue One. I had hoped this film was going to be as cataclysmic as The Empire Strikes Back in that it would set the scene for the grand finale. Instead I watched in utter disbelief as all the plot potential that the Force Awakens had set\, came crushing down in a grand amalgamation of utter chaos and disappointment. \nFor an audience with no knowledge of the legacy that is Star Wars\, then this film may be considered B grade at best. But for the rest of us\, it's a heart ache to bare witness to one of the greatest epics being ruined by poor direction/ story/ screen writing. You're better off watching the Phantom Menace...
